custom_fields.key_topics: Improv Comedy in both short and long forms.
custom_fields.assessment_structure: A midterm and final exam composed of short and long form improv performances to an open audience.
custom_fields.goals: The overall goals are to teach the fundamentals of improv comedy and have fun
custom_fields.relevance: They course teaches confidence in public speaking and unscripted social settings.
custom_fields.learning_resources: The students will have access to the syllabus and readings/videos relevant to the topics we are learning.
custom_fields.extra_time_commitment: Required viewing of assigned shows / podcasts.

long_desc: Through improv games and structured activities, students will learn the basic tenets of improvisational theater with a focus on both short and long form styles. These tenets will include the basic rules of improv, building base reality, listening, top of intelligence, finding and continuing game, and how to use support moves. No prior experience is necessary. Students will be expected to participate in group activities, discussions, and performances during class time. They may also be asked to watch performances or attend workshops outside of class. Students will have the opportunity to participate in an endofsemester showcase with a live audience.
name: Student Taught Courses (StuCo): Fundamentals of Improv Comedy
base_name: Student Taught Courses (StuCo): Fundamentals of Improv Comedy
